name: Arduino Programming
title: Ardunio programming cheat-sheet for I/O programming and  ardunio board programming.

cards.title: Intro
cards.body: Ardunio programming cheat-sheet for I/O programming and  ardunio board programming.

cards.title: Gather Necessary Materials
cards.body:
• Arduino Board: Any model, such as Arduino Uno, Mega, Nano, etc.
• USB Cable: Compatible with your Arduino board (commonly USB Type-A to Type-B for Uno).
• Computer: Windows, macOS, or Linux.

cards.title: Install the Arduino IDE
cards.body:
• windows/mac/linux
• Go to the Arduino Software page.
• Download the os installer.
• Run the installer and follow the instructions.

cards.title: Connect Your Arduino Board
cards.body:
• Connect the Arduino board to your computer using the USB cable.
• The power LED on the Arduino should light up, indicating it’s receiving power.

cards.title: Configure the Arduino IDE
cards.body:
• Open the Arduino IDE.
• Select Your Board:
• Go to Tools > Board and select the model of your Arduino board (e.g., Arduino Uno).

cards.title: Configure the Arduino IDE
cards.body: • Go to Tools > Port and select the port that the Arduino is connected to (it usually shows as COMx on Windows,
